subtitle: Will they ever go away?
title: ProudMOM: My baby has spots
content:
Brought to you by MAMA My baby was a beautiful newborn. Even the nurses told
me how pretty she was. She had a lot of dark hair and perfect little
fingernails. I felt so proud to show her off! But after 2 weeks she started to
get pimples all over her face. They started on her left cheek and spread to
cover her whole forehead and chin. She also had crusty areas over her
eyebrows, behind her ears and in her hair. It didn’t look very nice. I felt
embarrassed when people asked to see her. Sometimes I was tempted to squeeze
her pimples. But my mother told me it was better to leave them alone – no
special creams or ointments, just clean water. Luckily she couldn’t see
herself and didn’t seem to mind! I found it difficult to look at other babies.
Why did they look so perfect when my baby was covered in spots? I worried that
they would never go away. I wondered what had caused them. Was it something I
did or ate when I was pregnant? Luckily by the time she was 6 weeks old the
spots had gone and her skin was smooth again. She still had some crusts on her
head but they were hard to see because of her hair. She’s back to being the
beautiful baby she was when she was born, just a bit chubbier now! **MAMA
HELP: Most bumps and blotches on a newborn baby are harmless and clear up by
themselves. Your baby’s new skin is adjusting to the world.**
